title: Trump announces 25% tariff on India, 'plus penalty' for buying energy & arms from Russia
content: Donald Trump announced India will face a 25% tariff starting August 1st, along with penalties for energy and arms purchases from Russia. Trump cited high Indian tariffs and trade barriers, as well as continued reliance on Russian resources, as justification. The reciprocal tariffs for other countries will be effective August 1, 2025, according to Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick.

title: 'Were you sleeping in history class?' Jaishankar's 'China guru' dig at Rahul
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi in the Rajya Sabha, labeling him a "China-guru" and implying his understanding of China stemmed from Olympic invitations and private lessons from Chinese diplomats. Jaishankar defended his China visit, asserting transparency and contrasting it with alleged secret meetings by others during the 2008 Beijing Olympics.

title: 'All that taarif ...': Cong mocks PM Modi after Trump's 25% tariff
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party government. This criticism follows US President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 25% tariff on India. Congress claims India is paying for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's close ties with Trump. They highlighted Modi's support for Trump, yet tariffs were still imposed.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Don't understand the fuss': Gill breaks silence on Gambhir-curator spat
content: Tensions flared ahead of the crucial fifth Test at The Oval as India captain Shubman Gill addressed a controversy involving head coach Gautam Gambhir and curator Lee Fortis over pitch access. Gill questioned Fortis's conduct and restrictions, while Ben Stokes criticiced the demanding schedule. With England leading the series 2-1, the final Test is poised to be a dramatic conclusion.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warns: People use ChatGPT as a therapist, talk all personal stuff
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions against sharing sensitive personal information with ChatGPT, highlighting the lack of legal confidentiality. He points out that unlike therapists or doctors, conversations with AI are not protected, potentially creating privacy risks in legal situations. Altman suggests users should seek clarity on privacy before extensively using ChatGPT.

title: India Champions boycott Pakistan once again
content: India Champions will not play Pakistan in the World Championship of Legends semi-final. The team had earlier refused to play Pakistan in the league stage. A key sponsor, EaseMyTrip, withdrew support for the semi-final. They cited concerns about normalising relations with a country that promotes terrorism. India Champions had a mixed tournament, losing matches to South Africa, Australia, and England.

title: 'They rained bullets, you served them biryani': Nadda slams Cong in RS
content: JP Nadda criticized the Congress party's handling of past terror attacks. He contrasted the UPA government's response with the current government's actions. Nadda highlighted specific attacks and the perceived lack of action under the previous administration. He praised Prime Minister Modi's strong stance against terrorism. Nadda emphasized the importance of political will in combating terrorism.

title: Astronomer CEO Pete De Joy: To all of our employees at Astronomer; it's time for ...
content: Following a viral video involving its former CEO, Astronomer's current CEO, Pete DeJoy, has lauded his team's resilience. Amidst the controversy, the company hired Gwyneth Paltrow as a temporary spokesperson, releasing a humorous promotional clip. DeJoy expressed gratitude for his employees' dedication and thanked Maximum Effort for their work with Paltrow.

title: Nisar mission successful: Nasa-Isro satellite placed in sun-synchronous orbit
content: The Nisar mission’s primary objectives are to study land and ice deformation, land ecosystems and oceanic regions in areas of common interest to the US and Indian science communities.

title: India-UK ink defence pact to develop complex weapons, jet engines
content: India and the United Kingdom have unveiled a 10-year defence roadmap. The focus is on boosting cooperation and strengthening security ties. Both nations will work on co-development and joint research. They will also focus on innovation across defence technologies. Maritime security and military ties will also be strengthened. The roadmap aims for regional stability and a rules-based international order.

title: TCS layoffs: Ex-Tech Mahindra CEO quotes Sholay; CP Gurnani’s message sparks debate
content: Amidst TCS layoffs, CP Gurnani urges the Indian tech industry to move beyond headcount obsession and embrace outcome-based models. He emphasizes a shift from the traditional pyramid structure, advocating for enhanced productivity, specialized skills, and advanced technological capabilities. Experts suggest that upskilling and reskilling are crucial for tech professionals in this evolving landscape.

title: Watch: Patients wade through ankle-deep water as rain floods Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital
content: Torrential rains paralyzed Delhi, causing severe waterlogging at Safdarjung Hospital, where patients waded through flooded wards. In a tragic incident, a woman and her son, new to the city for work, died when a weakened boundary wall collapsed on their shelter in Sehgal Colony. Residents claim construction and tree cutting contributed to the wall's instability, leading to the fatal collapse.

title: Friendship Day: Wishes, messages, quotes, captions, to make your buddy feel special
content: International Friendship Day, established by the UN in 2011 and observed on July 30th, celebrates the cherished bonds of friendship. It's an opportunity to express gratitude and acknowledge the value friends bring to our lives. The day is marked by sharing heartfelt wishes, quotes, and messages that highlight the importance of loyalty, support, and shared memories.

title: Jasprit Bumrah IN or OUT? Shubman Gill gives crucial update
content: Will Jasprit Bumrah play in the crucial fifth Test against England at The Oval? Skipper Shubman Gill remained tight-lipped, citing a green wicket as a factor. Bumrah's form dipped in the drawn Manchester Test, with his pace noticeably reduced. Despite this, he remains a key bowler, tied with Siraj for most wickets.

title: 'Some people uncomfortable with history': Jaishankar slams Cong in RS over IWT
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the Rajya Sabha on Operation Sindoor, following the Pahalgam terror attack. He affirmed the government's firm stance against terrorism, highlighting diplomatic actions, including potentially suspending the Indus Waters Treaty. Jaishankar refuted claims of US mediation for a ceasefire between India and Pakistan.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Uneven gaps': Stokes slams scheduling after injury rules him out
content: Ben Stokes' shoulder injury sidelines him for the final Test against India, prompting him to criticise the series' demanding schedule and inconsistent gaps between matches. Stokes emphasised the physical and mental toll on both teams. He addressed the handshake controversy and praised the series' competitive spirit, while also commenting on the Oval's seam-friendly pitch.

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes out! England make big changes to playing XI
content: Ben Stokes' shoulder injury forces him to miss the final Test against India, leading to four changes in England's playing XI. Ollie Pope will take over the captaincy, while Ollie Pope will be the stand-in captain. Jacob Bethell, Gus Atkinson, Jamie Overton, and Josh Tongue are included, aiming to bolster the team's performance at The Oval.

title: Tsunami disrupts marine life: Hundreds of sea lions flee powerful waves – Watch
content: A powerful 8.8-magnitude earthquake off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami warnings across the Pacific, sending Steller sea lions fleeing to higher ground as waves crashed into the coast. While waves reached up to 4 meters in Kamchatka and impacted Japan, Alaska, and the US West Coast, little major damage was reported, though some injuries and flooding occurred.

title: 'Joyous day': PM hails return of Buddha's relics; back in India after 127 yrs
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the return of the sacred Piprahwa relics of Lord Buddha to India after 127 years. Discovered in 1898, the relics were taken abroad during the colonial period. The government intervened after the relics appeared in an international auction, emphasizing India's dedication to preserving its cultural heritage and its deep connection to Buddhism.

title: Bumrah OUT, Kuldeep and Arshdeep IN: India's predicted playing XI vs England
content: India and England will play the series-deciding final Test at the Kennington Oval. England leads the series 2-1. India aims to level the series. Dhruv Jurel will replace the injured Rishabh Pant. Ben Stokes is out due to injury. Ollie Pope will captain England. England has made four changes to their team.

title: IND vs ENG: Ben Stokes breaks silence on handshake row: 'Let’s not focus...'
content: England captain Ben Stokes addressed the controversy surrounding his handshake offer to Indian batsmen Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar during the drawn Old Trafford Test. Stokes, who will miss the final Test due to injury, defended his offer, stating he didn't want to bowl his main bowlers.

title: Jake Paul’s MVP makes massive women’s boxing contracts with Shannon Courtenay & others
content: Most Valuable Promotions (MVP), led by Jake Paul, has signed five prominent female boxers, including four world champions, on July 29, 2025. The new signees are Shannon Courtenay, Jasmine Artiga, Desley Robinson, Yesica Nery Plata, and Sa’Rai Brown‑El. This strategic move aims to globally expand women's boxing, adding to MVP's already impressive roster of female fighters.

title: On Day 1 of posting, UP SDM does sit-ups in front of advocates over tehsil filth
content: IAS officer Rinku Singh Rahi, newly appointed SDM, took a unique approach to address cleanliness issues in Puwaiyan tehsil. Confronted by striking advocates about the dirty premises, Rahi acknowledged the problem and performed sit-ups as a form of accepting responsibility. He had previously made offenders and parents of truant children do sit-ups to deter undesirable behavior.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ box office collection: Mohit Suri's movie inches towards Rs 270 crore mark
content: ‘Saiyaara’, starring Aneet Padda and Ahaan Panday, continues its box office domination, surpassing collections of films like ‘Sikandar’ and ‘Housefull 5’. Despite facing competition from ‘Mahavtar Narsimha’, the film earned ₹9.25 crore on its second Monday and showed slight growth on Tuesday. With a total collection of ₹270 crore

title: Slapped for ‘insulting’ Dimple Yadav: Maulana assaulted after TV debate
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi was allegedly assaulted in Noida by individuals claiming affiliation with the Samajwadi Party, following a news debate. The altercation stemmed from Rashidi's purported derogatory remarks against MP Dimple Yadav. Kuldeep Bhati, identifying himself as a Samajwadi Party member, posted a video online claiming responsibility.

title: ITR-3 enabled for e-filing: Key things to know before filing for AY 2025–26
content: The Income Tax Department has facilitated online ITR-3 filing for AY 2025-26, benefiting individuals with income from share trading, business ventures, and unlisted shares. Key updates include mandatory Form 10-IEA selection, revised capital gains reporting, and higher asset/liability reporting thresholds. Filers must also provide detailed disclosures on TDS sections and deductions.

title: Another dog named Dogesh Babu’s residence certificate application raises eyebrows
content: A bizarre incident occurred in Bihar. An online application for a residential certificate was submitted under the name Dogesh Babu. The application included a dog's photo. This prompted District Magistrate Ravi Prakash to order a police investigation. This follows a similar incident in Patna. There, a residential certificate was issued to a dog. Authorities are taking these incidents seriously.

title: ‘I got some peace’: Pahalgam terror attack victim’s wife on killing of 3 terrorists
content: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the Lok Sabha on Tuesday, outlining the government's response to the Pahalgam terror attack through Operation Sindoor and the recent success of Operation Mahadev, the families of the victims expressed relief and gratitude.

title: Tsunami hits Japan: High waves hit Hokkaido; 1.3-metre waves observed
content: Following a powerful 8.8 magnitude earthquake near Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula, Japan's Pacific coastline is under tsunami alert, with potential waves reaching 3 meters. Evacuations are underway from Hokkaido to Wakayama, including the Fukushima nuclear facility. A woman died in Mie prefecture during evacuation. Nissan halted operations at some plants.

title: Watch: Spanish fighter jet loses control during airshow; almost crashes into crowd
content: A Spanish Air Force pilot averted a potential disaster at the 2025 Festival Aéreo Internacional de Gijón, skillfully maneuvering his EF-18 Hornet to avoid a flock of birds. The quick reaction, described as "exemplary speed and professionalism," prevented a possible impact during a low-altitude flypast witnessed by over 300,000 spectators.

title: Exclusive | Gambhir's message to Jurel: 'Mauka milega, ready rehna'
content: Twice in the five-match series, Dhruv Jurel was asked to don the wicketkeeping gloves — and the 24-year-old didn’t disappoint his captain. In the third Test, after coming on as a substitute keeper, he took three catches. In the fourth Test, he displayed sharp reflexes behind the stumps, effecting two stumpings and taking two catches.

title: UNSC report: TRF published Pahalgam attack site photo, claimed responsibility twice
content: A UN Security Council report has implicated The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy of Lashkar-e-Tayyiba (LeT), in the deadly Pahalgam attack. The report, explicitly mentions TRF's involvement and highlights the links between TRF and LeT, supported by Pakistan.

title: Meet Mira Murati: The AI brain behind ChatGPT; rejected Zuckerberg’s$1BMetaoffer
content: Mira Murati, the former CTO of OpenAI, rejected a $1 billion offer from Meta, demonstrating her team's confidence in her leadership and the vision of her AI startup, Thinking Machines Lab. Despite Meta's lucrative offers to team members, they chose to remain independent, believing in the potential of their equity and the opportunity to shape AI's future.

title: 'It is entitled behaviour of English' - Ex-India keeper on Gambhir vs curator
content: A controversy involving Gautam Gambhir and Lee Fortis has surfaced before the crucial fifth Test match between India and England. The incident occurred during India's practice session. Parthiv Patel supported Gambhir and criticised England's behaviour. Patel also highlighted the importance of domestic leagues and praised young Indian wicketkeepers Rishabh Pant and Dhruv Jurel.

title: 'If PM says something ... ': Rahul says Modi unable to refute Trump's ceasefire claims
content: Rahul Gandhi criticizes Narendra Modi regarding Donald Trump's assertions about mediating peace. Rahul suggests Modi can't refute Trump due to potential revelations. S Jaishankar denies any phone calls between Modi and Trump during a specific period. Rahul challenges Modi to call Trump a liar in Parliament.

title: SC reserves verdict on Justice Varma's plea - What the top court said
content: The Supreme Court has reserved its decision on Justice Yashwant Varma's challenge to a report finding him culpable in a cash discovery matter. The court questioned Varma's participation in the inquiry without initially contesting its validity. His counsel argued that the panel's removal suggestion violated constitutional principles, emphasizing the problematic precedent it would establish.

title: Microsoft restores IT service to Russia-backed Indian refinery after EU sanctions
content: Microsoft has restored IT services to Nayara Energy, an Indian oil refinery backed by Russia. A lawsuit was filed by Nayara Energy due to service suspension following EU sanctions. The sanctions have significantly impacted Nayara's operations, leading to reduced refinery activities. Microsoft confirmed the restoration of services after Nayara's lawyer informed a New Delhi court that the matter had been resolved.

title: Bank Holidays in August: On what days will banks be closed? Check list
content: August 2025 will see several bank holidays across India. Banks will be closed nationwide for Independence Day on August 15th. Various regional holidays, including Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Raksha Bandhan, Janmashtami, and Ganesh Chaturthi, will also lead to closures in specific states.

title: Typhoon Co-May makes landfall in China: Orange alert issued in Shanghai
content: Typhoon Co-May disrupted eastern China, making landfall in Zhoushan with 83 km/h winds, prompting mass evacuations of over 280,000 people. Shanghai faced flight cancellations, with over 640 flights grounded across its airports. Ferry services were halted, and speed limits were imposed. Simultaneously, a powerful earthquake off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami alerts, later lifted, adding to the region's natural scare.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Kwan to Jays? Maybe, but pitching comes first
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on Thursday approaches.

title: Shooter targeted NFL HQ, claimed to have CTE
content: A gunman who killed four people at a Manhattan office building was trying to target the headquarters of the NFL but took the wrong elevator.

title: Sources: Ravens TE Likely has small foot fracture
content: Baltimore Ravens tight end Isaiah Likely suffered a small fracture in his foot at the end of Tuesday's practice, sources told ESPN.

title: Browns' Emerson out for year with torn Achilles
content: Browns cornerback Martin Emerson Jr. has a torn left Achilles and will be out for the 2025 season, coach Kevin Stefanski announced Wednesday.

title: Braves' Acuna 'worried,' IL-bound due to Achilles
content: Ronald Acuna Jr. exited Atlanta's loss at Kansas City on Tuesday night because of tightness in his right Achilles after chasing down a ball in right field.

title: Magic, Grizzlies to play in Berlin, London in 2026
content: The NBA will play at least six regular-season games in Europe over the next three seasons, starting with a pair of games between the Grizzlies and Magic in January.

title: Marchand breaks Lochte's 200m medley record
content: Léon Marchand broke the world record in the 200-meter individual medley Wednesday at the world championships in Singapore, clocking 1 minute, 52.61 seconds to surpass the 1:54.00 set in 2011 by Ryan Lochte.

title: Ex-WWE boss McMahon cited over 3-car crash
content: Former WWE CEO Vince McMahon is accused of causing a crash on a Connecticut highway that wrecked his Bentley and damaged two other cars.

title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: 'They are all counting on me': How Lynx's Collier juggles her many roles
content: Mom, franchise player, union VP, Unrivaled co-founder, MVP front-runner. Napheesa Collier adeptly juggles it all.

title: The routine move that changed everything for pro wrestler Chris Bey
content: After a life-changing spinal cord injury, Chris Bey wasn't expected to walk again. Nine months later, he's not only walking, he is eyeing a return to professional wrestling.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: 11 college football teams ready to either build on last season or put it behind them
content: FSU has nowhere to go but up, Michigan can get way better and Arizona State is building on its CFP berth. Which other teams are primed for bigger things in 2025?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Houston is No. 1, and we'll have a new WAC champ
content: Grand Canyon moved up its timeline to switch from the WAC to the Mountain West, which significantly shifts the bracket dynamics.

title: USWNT newcomers ranked: All 24 players who have debuted under coach Emma Hayes
content: The USWNT roster has undergone sweeping change under coach Emma Hayes. Let's rank the new players by how likely it is they'll represent the U.S. at the next World Cup.

title: Leaving Liverpool: Díaz transfer is a big gamble for Bayern
content: What was behind Luis Díaz's desire to leave Liverpool? And are Bayern getting a difference maker in their star signing?

title: August urgency will soon end the lull in soccer's summer transfer window
content: The final days of July are the dog days of soccer's summer transfer window, but August will bring a flurry of wheeling and dealing.

title: Power Rankings: Sparks, Valkyries headed in opposite directions
content: Los Angeles rides a win streak (and Cameron Brink's return) up the latest edition, and Golden State struggles.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the trade deadline.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: How Ichiro's HOF induction helps tell the story of Japanese baseball
content: On Ichiro Suzuki's induction weekend, a new exhibit in Cooperstown shares his place in the international baseball landscape.

title: 'Just a top-shelf human being': Teammates, opponents remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: Six late-round 'fliers' who can help you win your league
content: Hitting on a player late in drafts can be a big boost -- to your team and your ego. Here are six "fliers" you need to be considering.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian GP in Budapest
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: Piastri halts Norris momentum in F1's knife-edge title fight
content: Lando Norris had won three of the past five F1 races, but Oscar Piastri took a clinical win in Belgium.

title: 'The story's not done yet': England celebrate Euro 2025 win with London parade
content: England partied with 65,000 fans (and Burna Boy) outside Buckingham Palace after winning Euro 2025. But they already have one eye on the World Cup.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 8 Live Updates: Amit Shah Thanks Armed Forces For Response To J&K Attack
content: Live: Amit Shah thanked the armed forces and Prime Minister Narendra Modi for orchestrating Operation Sindoor in response to the April 22 Pahalgam attack.

title: "Fadnavis Act": Sanjay Raut's Big Allegation As Agency Probes Civic Official
content: The Enforcement Directorate's ongoing probe into former Vasai-Virar Municipal Commissioner Anil Pawar has triggered political tremors in Maharashtra

title: Trump Says Epstein Was Banned From Mar-A-Lago For "Stealing" Women From Spa
content: Trump recounted his decision to expel Epstein from the private Palm Beach club after learning the disgraced financier had recruited staff from the resort's luxury spa.

title: Russia Earthquake, Tsunami LIVE Updates: Chile Upgraded Tsunami Warning To The Highest Level After Earthquake
content: Russia Earthquake, Tsunami LIVE Updates:An earthquake of magnitude 8.8 - one of the world's strongest-struck Russia's Far Eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early on Wednesday, generating a tsunami of up to 4 metres (13 feet).

title: Odisha Man Murders Wife, Her Mother, Plants Banana Trees To Hide Buried Bodies
content: A man in Odisha murdered his wife and her mother and tried to eliminate evidence by planting banana trees over the bodies he buried in his garden.

title: From "Tariff King" To "Big Charger", Trump's Comments On Trade With India
content: US President Donald Trump announced a 25 per cent plus tariff on India effective from August 1. While the US President described India as a "friend", he said the US has done "little business" with India because of the Asian country's high tariff.

title: Gautam Adani Calls For Deeper India-Vietnam Economic Partnership
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani met with Vietnam's Communist Party General Secretary To Lam and discussed several matters of mutual economic interests.

title: ISRO Successfully Launches NISAR, World's Most Expensive Earth Imaging Satellite
content: The world's most expensive civilian Earth imaging satellite NISAR (NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar Satellite) has lifted off from Sriharikota in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Tariffs: The West Botched Up Russia ... And Now Wants India To Foot The Bill
content: The West has grudgingly recognised its inability to persuade India not to buy Russian oil. However, anti-Russian lobbies continue to apply pressure on New Delhi, seeing that their goal of imposing a strategic defeat on Russia has proved illusory.

title: "Obnoxious Non-Monetary Trade Barriers": Trump's Tariffs And Penalty For 'Friend' India
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a 25 per cent tariff on India from Aug 1, amid signs of some stalemate in the ongoing negotiations between the two countries on a bilateral trade deal.

title: Live Updates: Trump Announces 25% Tariff On India Along With Penalty
content: Trump Tariffs Live Updates: US President Donald Trump has announced 25 per cent tariffs on India, whom he called a "US friend".

title: Oprah Winfrey Faces Backlash Over Claims Of Not Opening Private Road For Tsunami Evacuation
content: Oprah Winfrey is facing backlash on social media over claims that she did not open her private road connecting Wailea to Kula, Hawaii, to help people evacuate to higher ground after the tsunami warning.

title: Why The Russia Earthquake, Sixth Strongest Ever Recorded, Did Not Affect Moscow
content: The 8.8 earthquake that struck the Russian Far East on July 29, was barely felt in the Russian capital of Moscow

title: Opinion: Opinion | All The Ways Epstein Continues To Haunt Donald Trump
content: No matter how far President Trump flies - whether to Mar-a-Lago, Manhattan or the manicured golf greens of Scotland (from where he returned on Tuesday) - the ghost of Jeffrey Epstein refuses to part with him.

title: CBI Files 22 FIRs Against Delhi-NCR Builder-Bank Nexus After Top Court Order
content: The CBI has registered 22 FIRs on the Supreme Court's directions to investigate the "unholy nexus" of builders and banks to cheat homebuyers in NCR, officials on Wednesday said.

title: Boulder Falls On Army Vehicle In Ladakh; Rescue Operations Underway
content: A boulder fell on an army vehicle, part of a convoy, in a remote area in eastern Ladakh on Wednesday, and a rescue operation has been launched.

title: "Don't Control Me": Jaya Bachchan Scolds Fellow MP, Sparks A 'Sindoor' Row
content: Samajwadi Party MP and veteran actor Jaya Bachchan sparked a row today after she questioned Operation Sindoor's name and asked why it was named so when the Pahalgam terror attack "destroyed the sindoor" of so many women.

title: On Camera, Pet Husky's Sudden Attack On Woman At Posh Gurugram Complex
content: A woman's walk inside a posh residential complex in Gurugram turned into a nightmare when a pet Husky attacked her and bit her hand

title: "Dubo Dubo Ke Marenge": MNS' Toon 'Threat' To BJP Leader Amid Language Row
content: The "dubo dubo ke marenge (we will drown them)" threat from Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray has now made a pictorial entry in Maharashtra in the backdrop of the language row.

title: Hackers Steal Rs 380 Crore In Cryptocurrency From CoinDCX, Employee Arrested
content: Bengaluru police are investigating a massive cryptocurrency theft from leading crypto exchange CoinDCX after hackers allegedly siphoned off nearly $44 million (approximately Rs 384 crore) from the company's wallets.

title: IT Hub for Kozhikode has become a pipe dream, says MP
content: The reply given by the Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT on the status of the project was vague, he says

title: KAU conducts drone-based seed sowing in Pokkali fields
content: A drone capable of carrying and dispersing up to 10 kg of germinated seeds was deployed in the trial, reducing manual effort and time

title: Hubballi-Dharwad Mayor Jyoti Patil promises clean, pro-people governance
content: The newly-elected Mayor emphasises that she will work towards taking everyone into confidence while facilitating more development works

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: High drama over council meeting agenda results in suspension of three Congress councillors
content: One opposition member taken to hospital as she falls down while being removed by marshals outside the meeting hall in Hubballi

title: Building collapse: Collector’s probe dismisses delay in rescue mission in Kottayam MCH
content: In a report submitted to Rajan N. Khobragade, Additional Chief Secretary, Health and Family Welfare department, Collector John V. Samuel states  there were no lapses on the part of any officials in the incident

title: Keralite nuns’ arrest: KPCC takes out protest march to Raj Bhavan
content: Chhattisgarh government had foisted false charges against the nuns and had manipulated the FIR by adding non-existent legal clauses, thus denying them bail, says the KPCC chief

title: Lok Sabha gives nod to statutory resolution approving extension of President's Rule in Manipur
content: Speaker Om Birla said President’s Rule was imposed in Manipur on February 13 and the House had approved it on April 2

title: Trump slaps 25% tariff on imports from India ‘plus a penalty’ for buying Russian oil, weapons, and ‘obnoxious’ trade barriers
content: “While India is our friend”, its tariffs are “far too high, among the highest in the world, and they have the most strenuous and obnoxious non-monetary trade barriers of any country,” Mr. Trump says in Truth Social post

title: Sanitation workers call off strike in Nellore after intervention from Minister, MLA
content: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister Ponguru Narayana over phone assured the workers to cancel the contract system, which was initiated as a pilot project in the district

title: State govt. is encouraging growth of small-scale industries, says Minister
content: Sharanabasappa Darshanapur addresses workshop on lean project and zero defect, zero effect and import at a private hotel in Yadgir

title: 3 accidents involving train-road traffic collisions in 3.5 years: Railway Minister
content: The Minister also discussed the construction of road-over-bridges (ROBs) and road-under-bridges (RUBs) as measures to eliminate level crossings

title: MP flags scarcity of urea, gaps in supply chain in Andhra Pradesh
content: In letter to Union Chemicals and Fertilizers Minister Nadda, Rajya Sabha member Subhas Chandra Bose calls for swift and decisive action to mitigate the problems of the farming community

title: Study warns of risks to elephants habituated to human feeding in Sigur plateau
content: The fates of Mudumalai’s famous elephants, named after Brazilian footballers, highlight dangers of illegal elephant feeding

title: IT Minister Lokesh seeks establishment of Microsoft Experience Zone in Andhra Pradesh
content: During his tour in Singapore, Lokesh highlights investment opportunities in the semiconductor and EV sectors

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: 5,000 gifted children to benefit from SIET workshops for them
content: Workshop that integrates STEM with robotics and art will be held in the 41 educational districts with focus on value-creation pedagogy

title: Indian statement on Pahalgam attackers ‘replete with fabrications’, says Pakistan
content: Instead of misleading their compatriots, the Indian leaders would be well-advised to acknowledge the losses incurred by their armed forces and accept the active role played by the third parties in realising the ceasefire, the statement said

title: Youth and minor girlfriend held for ‘puppy theft and gold burglary’ in Vijayawada
content: Duo stole Shih Tzu, gold worth ₹20 lakh, and a bike; tracked using phone records and CCTV footage, say police

title: WCL semifinal: Indian Champions refuse to play against Pakistan
content: The Indian team which includes legends like Shikhar Dhawan, Irfan Pathan, Harbhajan Singh, Yuvraj Singh, Suresh Raina among others have already expressed their unwillingness to play against Pakistan following the Pahalgam attack

title: Chief Secretary stresses on coordinated efforts to make Andhra Pradesh drug-free
content: Vijayanand says EAGLE, the government-formed anti-narcotics group, is actively working to curb ganja cultivation in tribal areas of North Andhra Pradesh

title: 'Atrocious, shocking': Cong slams Jaishankar's remarks on Nehru, Indus Waters Treaty
content: Congress criticises Jaishankar for calling Indus Waters Treaty appeasement, sparking a heated debate on Nehru’s policies

title: Assam film actress arrested in hit-and-run case as victim dies
content: The accident took place at Dakkhingaon area in the early hours of Friday when an SUV allegedly driven by the actress hit a two-wheeler ridden by the victim

title: ‘Meda’ takes the carbon-neutral home dream a step closer to reality
content: The green home concept, under a CWRDM-assisted initiative, has recorded net carbon sink status of -1.43 tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent (tCO2e), thus achieving carbon neutrality

title: Madhya Pradesh woman judicial officer resigns in protest over elevation of district judge to High Court
content: In her strongly worded letter, she expressed a sense of profound betrayal, not from criminals or wrongdoers, but from the very judicial system she had sworn to uphold

title: Over 60 Sri Lankan Tamils in Namakkal rehabilitation camp told to leave or renew visas
content: Last week, the police in Paramathi Velur issued them written notices, directing them to leave the country within 10 days, as they have neither renewed their visas nor returned to Sri Lanka.

title: SC questions Justice Varma’s conduct, says he moved the apex court only after in-house inquiry results became ‘unpalatable’
content: The in-house inquiry report had sounded ‘death knell’, become ‘prompt and trigger’ for removal motion, senior advocate Kapil Sibal argues; SC reserves the case for orders

title: Three militants among four held in Manipur
content: “Two active cadres of the proscribed Kangleipak Communist Party were apprehended from Nongada Awang Leikai in Imphal East district and from Langthabal Kunja in Imphal West district,” a senior officer said

title: Congress MLA Nayana Motamma shares dais with Pramod Mutalik, speech in Mudigere goes viral
content: Congress MLA Nayana Motamma says questions about whether she will join the BJP, SDPI or BSP will be answered three years later

title: Union Ministers Suresh Gopi, George Kurian come under fire from LDF for remaining silent on arrest of Kerala nuns in Chhattisgarh
content: Kerala Minister Sivankutty says Suresh Gopi’s ‘speechlessness’ on the issue is surprising, given the latter’s demonstrative affinity for Christians and their faith

title: CISF conducts psychometric assessment of 31,000 personnel deployed at sensitive locations in national capital
content: ‘Mental health is as mission critical as physical fitness for our personnel,’ the Director General, CISF, said; Project Mann initiative has reached personnel at Parliament, Delhi airport, and Delhi Metro

title: Vedas protect those who nurture it: Justice G.R. Swaminathan
content: Recounting an old case in which a Vedic scholar was convicted and sentenced to 18 months of imprisonment over an accident that killed a man, the judge said the incident took place when he was a practicing lawyer.

title: Congress loses its last MLA in Meghalaya
content: The State’s Assembly Speaker Thomas A. Sangma confirmed the resignation of Ronnie V. Lyngdoh from the Congress, and his merger with the National People’s Party

title: LDF MPs from Kerala to seek meeting with Modi, Amit Shah to flag arrest of Keralite nuns in BJP-ruled Chhattisgarh
content: A.A. Rahim, who is in Chhattisgarh as part of LDF delegation, says Bajrang Dal activists thronged sessions court premises in Durg and raised intimidatory slogans, chanting that the nuns did not deserve bail

title: Congress MP Venugopal slams Kerala nuns’ arrest in Chhattisgarh, asks Centre to intervene
content: BJP MP from Durg, Vijay Baghel, alleged a conspiracy by the Congress MPs to disturb communal harmony and came out in support of the Chhattisgarh government for arresting the nuns

title: No third-party intervention in India-Pakistan ceasefire: Jaishankar in Rajya Sabha
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar denies third-party intervention in India-Pakistan ceasefire, emphasises India’s strong stance against terrorism and accountability

title: Priyanka Gandhi slams Centre for ‘inaction’ on Wayanad rehabilitation
content: Raising the matter in Lok Sabha, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demands that Central government reconsider its decision to provide a meagre loan assistance for Wayanad

title: Karnataka rain: Shivanasamudra waterfalls come alive in all their glory following surge in outflow from dams
content: Tourist footfall has increased in recent days given the substantial increase in water released from the Krishnaraja Sagar (KRS) and the Kabini reservoirs upstream

title: The troubling takeover of Bengaluru’s open playgrounds
content: Several playgrounds in Bengaluru that were once thriving, energetic hotspots of organic multi-sport activities have disappeared, either gobbled up for infrastructure projects or replaced by flashy, ‘pay and play’ sporting facilities.

title: Congress steps up attack on PM Modi for ‘refusing to unequivocally’ deny Trump’s ceasefire claims
content: PM Modi not able to say ‘Trump is lying’ as U.S. President will lay bare truth, says Rahul Gandhi; Congress chief Kharge says the Prime Minister should have condemned Trump’s remarks

title: Space-based inputs supporting govt's flagship initiatives: Minister Jitendra Singh tells Lok Sabha
content: Mr. Singh said the Bhuvan Geoportal and database of Aadhaar enrolment centres, use of space technology for a geocoded postal address system, and rooftop photo voltaic (PV) potential assessment for 60 solar cities and smart cities have been done to support the Digital India and Smart Cities Mission.

title: NISAR mission launch LIVE: GSLV-F 16 successfully places NISAR satellite in orbit
content: The first joint satellite of ISRO and NASA will study land and ice deformation, land ecosystems, and oceanic regions in areas of common interest to the U.S. and Indian science communities

title: Karnataka approves cleft care mentorship programme in State-run hospitals
content: Surgical correction of sleft lip or cleft palate is essential for the physical, psychological, and social rehabilitation of affected individuals

title: Three migrant labourers die in accident at poultry waste plant in Kerala’s Malappuram
content: Exact cause of accident remains unclear. It is believed to have occurred while the men were cleaning a chemical treatment tank. The trio were found unconscious and trapped inside the tank

title: Tirunelveli caste killing: Probe transferred to CB-CID; accused Surjith detained under Goondas Act
content: The interrogation of Surjith’s parents, SIs Saravanan and Krishnakumari, who have been placed under suspension after being named in the FIR, is still under way

title: Samajwadi Party workers slap Muslim cleric who made 'derogatory' comment on Dimple Yadav
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi, the cleric, had criticised Ms. Yadav, wife of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, for isiting a mosque near Parliament without covering her head.

title: Road to Belagavi airport to be widened
content: A technical committee is looking into the feasibility of building a flyover to connect the airport with the city, the Minister said

title: CAT 2025 registration begins from August 1
content: IIM Kozhikode designated as coordinating institute for CAT 2025. Registration process will remain open till 5 p.m. on September 13

title: Is public art in Hyderabad losing its local touch?
content: Murals and sculptures brighten up flyovers and traffic islands in Hyderabad, but artists feel many lack cultural context and local relevance

title: Indian Consulate in San Francisco issues warning for tsunami threat post 8.8 magnitude earthquake
content: "Based on pre-run model scenarios, there is no threat to India," the centre said in a bulletin issued in the morning. No further bulletins will be issued by ITEWC-INCOIS unless other information becomes available, it said.

title: Eviction drive under way for second day in Assam to clear encroachment on 1,500 hectares of forest land
content: “The exercise, once completed, will displace around 1,500 families, mostly from the Muslim community,” officials said

title: Why Ichiro, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are Hall of Famers
content: Ichiro Suzuki, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame . the trio stands out for their disparate backgrounds . they were a star in the Japan Pacific League at 20 years old before becoming the first Japanese position player .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Lamar Jackson dazzles with long TD; Malik Nabers 'OK'
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: They (finally) meet again: Three keys to Liberty-Lynx WNBA Finals rematch
content: the new york Liberty won the franchise's first WNBA title this past October . the Liberty lost 67-62 to the Minnesota Lynx in a grind-it-out series . nine months later, they have yet to play this season .

title: 🎮 EA Sports reveals '99 Club' for Madden NFL 26
content: squon barkley was confirmed as a member of the iconic 99 Club . he'll be the only player to start off with a 99 OVR . his blocking stats are well over 90 across the board . the Buffalo Bills quarterback sports immense general stats .

title: Dolphins CB Kohou (knee) to miss entire season
content: cornerback Kader Kohou will miss the entire season after suffering a knee injury . the team will place Kohou on injured reserve . he suffered the injury during one-on-one drills and limped to the locker room .

title: Last-minute MLB trade deadline intel: What Buster Olney and Jeff Passan are hearing
content: the new york Mets are the epicenter of the teams looking to part with players . but between now and the deadline, the Mets might be the most aggressive club a season . a lot of big names have been involved in the trades, including the san francisco .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Pope, Donnarumma in goalkeeper search
content: Beth Lindop believes that Liverpool should prioritise signing a centre-back amid links to striker Alexander Isak . the 33-year-old is a short-term option for the club as they look set to bring in a stopper . talksSPORT claims that Pope, 33, is an option .

title: Liverpool won the Premier League and now they're on a spending spree. Why?
content: a year ago, no one was excited about the club and the fan base was ready to panic . the reds were coming off a bounce-back season where they were top of the table in April . a slew of injuries pulled them back into third place, behind arsenal and manchester city .

title: Free agency NBA Power Rankings: Where the Rockets, Raptors and others land this offseason
content: the 2025-26 offseason is in full swing, and teams continue to sort out unresolved agreements . the Houston Rockets acquired 15-time All-Star Kevin Durant from the Phoenix Suns . other veteran names were also on the move this offseason .

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas Tech's big moves land it in the top 25
content: at least four top-50 prospects are expected to make announcements over the next month . the top classes could see some more big changes before week 1 kicks off . OT Keenyi Pepe has double-digit ESPN 300 commits, with several joining the list .

title: Can Bronny James realistically make the Lakers’ rotation in Year 2?
content: the los Angeles Lakers lost to the Dallas Mavericks in the summer league . he scored eight points on 2-for-8 shooting, including 1-for-6 from 3 . two days later, he missed a potential game-winning trey in the closing seconds .
